paper_abstract: High-density short oligonucleotide microarrays are a primary research tool for assessing global gene expression. Background noise on microarrays comprises a significant portion of the measured raw data. A number of statistical techniques have been developed to correct for this background noise. Here, we demonstrate that probe minimum folding energy and structure can be used to enhance a previously existing model for background noise correction. We estimate that probe secondary structure accounts for up to 3% of all variation on Affymetrix microarrays. (c) 2007 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Software Note: Using probe secondary structure information to enhance Affymetrix GeneChip background estimates
